[Mor lam](/wiki/Mor_lam) - [Ram wong](/wiki/Romvong) - Ram Thai - Rabam - [Kingkara](/wiki/Peacock_dance) Vietnam - [Nhã nhạc](/wiki/Nh%C3%A3_nh%E1%BA%A1c) - v - t - e ***Payung* dance** ([Minangkabau](/wiki/Minangkabau_language): ***tari Payuang***; [Jawi](/wiki/Jawi_alphabet): **تاري ڤايوڠ**) is a [folk dance-drama](/wiki/Dance_in_Indonesia) [tradition](/wiki/Adat) of the [Minangkabau](/wiki/Minangkabau_people)-[Malay ethnic group](/wiki/Malays_(ethnic_group)) in [Sumatra](/wiki/Sumatra), [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia). This dance is a Minangkabau version of other Malay dances from Sumatra. Folk theatre such as *[toneel](/wiki/Toneel)* and *[sandiwara](/wiki/Sandiwara)* often incorporates *payung* dance as part of the show. The *payung* (umbrella) is the main prop used in this dance, and the dance itself, which is usually performed by three or four dancers, symbolizes [affection](/wiki/Affection) and the [relationship](/wiki/Relationship_(archaeology)) of young people. The dance originates from [Western Sumatra](/wiki/West_Sumatra), [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia). *Payung* dance is performed as a part of *toneel*, *sandiwara*, exhibition, opening of party, or wedding occasion of Minangkabau people. ## Etymology In the [Indonesian language](/wiki/Languages_of_Indonesia), *payung* ([Indonesian](/wiki/Indonesian_language)) or *payuang* ([Minangkabau](/wiki/Minangkabau_language)) means "umbrella" or "parasol". The dance-drama is called *payung* dance because it uses the umbrella as the main prop to represent security and protection in a marital relationship. ## Philosophy Payung dance uses *payung* ([umbrella](/wiki/Umbrella)) and *selendang* ([shawl](/wiki/Shawl)) as props. The *payung* is used by men and the *selendang* is used by women in the dance. The *payung* symbolizes protection which for men is generally considered the main function in the family. The [male](/wiki/Male) dancer protects the [female](/wiki/Female) dancer's head. The *selendang* used by female dancers symbolizes the sacred bond of [love](/wiki/Love) between a couple. The shawl also symbolizes a woman's loyalty and readiness to foster a [household](/wiki/Household) with a [husband](/wiki/Husband). This idea is performed when the *selendang* of the female dancer is placed on the male dancer. ## Similar dances *Payung* dance is also performed by Peranakan communities of Malaysia. *Payung* dance originated in China and was brought to Malaysia by Chinese diaspora living in the country. This dance evolved with local elements to form a popular type of Peranakan dance. - Theatre portal - Indonesia portal - [Dance in Indonesia](/wiki/Dance_in_Indonesia) - [Lilin dance](/wiki/Candle_dance) - [Pasambahan dance](/wiki/Pasambahan_dance) - [Piring dance](/wiki/Piring_dance) - [Randai](/wiki/Randai)
